text: (Joff) Rick Scott attracted criticism from environmentalists to deny in 2011 that humans contribute to climate change and now avoid questions with the answer from "I'm not a scientist." Instead of answering the question directly, Scott claimed that he had already taken action to protect the environment, including addressing sea-level rise. "We spent $350 million dealing with sea level rise down in Keyes, or down in Miami. We've spent hundreds of millions of dollars dealing with coral reefs," he said. Scott filed a similar claim in the discussion at Broward College on 15 October. Scott ' s claim, particularly about investing in projects to combat sea-level rise, stands out to us.
